title.narrative: Strategic Sector Cooperation on Health in China (Phase I)

description.narrative:
Strategic Sector Cooperation on Health Between Denmark and China, Phase I
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on health is a peer-to-peer cooperation between The Danish Medicines Agency and China National Medical Administration within the health sector. The main objective of the Strategic Sector Cooperation is to support increased access to care through effective management of healthcare systems in China. Denmark and China share a common goal of improving healthcare management in order to achieve better quality and more cost-efficient healthcare solutions in order to meet future challenges in the sector.
The SSC cooperation contributes to capacity development in order to inspire process optimization, supporting the public healthcare sector of China. The SSC project encompasses a two-fold approach outlined in two sub-projects: Medicines and Medical Devices (Sub-project 1) and Primary Health Care (Sub-project 2).

title.narrative: Not applicable as baseline, impact indicators are not defined for current SSC projects.
